Content:
﻿[CEO]
(MV) It has been about 5 months since you were appointed to Korea. Please share your views on the Korean market and your goals and plans for the future term. 
The past four months have been a dynamic and very interesting time to grasp the Korean market through meetings with Korean customers and various partners at various events.
As mentioned earlier, in many ways, the Korean market has a distinct characteristic of the so-called K-Sprit, and I think it is the best market to implement various initiatives.
More discussion should be made about future plans, but what is certain is that we will further enhance the overall counter customer journey and experience in terms of product, marketing, and purchasing experience etc. Let me share more details about each momentum when the specific time is determined.

(MV) Your career path seems to be related to many aspects of online sales, which are future trends such as digital services and e-commerce. What plans are there in the Korean market. 
Before joining Mercedes-Benz Korea, I worked as the Head of Mercedes me, Digital Services Business and eCommerce at Mercedes-Benz Group AG. Therefore, upon coming to Korea, my initial focus was on enhancing the overall customer journey. 
In October, we first streamlined the purchasing process on our Mercedes-Benz's online store, making it simpler and strengthening the convenience of our e-commerce platform. 
Moving on to December, we introduced the in-car store, allowing customers to purchase our digital products directly within Mercedes-Benz vehicles. 
We are targeting to sell 13% of new cars and 15% of CPO sale through online in 2024.
Furthermore, we are planning to offer various digital services like 1-month subscription to enhance the purchase experience.

[2023 Sales Performance (vs. BMW) & 2024 Sales Target]
(MV) MBK has been the No. 1 among imported car brands for seven consecutive years but lost the top spot to BMW last year. What were the reasons behind? 
The 2023 annual sales of MBK marked 76,697 units. (KAIDA, 2022: 80,976 / -5.3% YoY)
Under the volatile market condition, MBK had demonstrated a strong market position, especially in the second half with an upward monthly performance trend (1st Half: 35,423, 2nd Half: 41,274). 
In 2023, MBK did not aim for sales volume or market No.1. We have solidified our strategic direction of ‘Electrification’ and ‘Luxury’ and have introduced a wide range of models. This has been proved by our sales figures. 
(Based on KAIDA & Carisyou registration data)

Electrification
	First of all, last year, we enlarged our EV portfolio by introducing various models such as SUVs (EQS SUV, EQE SUV) and high-performance (AMG EQE) models. 
As a result, MB electric vehicles increased +70.8% YoY to 9,182 units (11.9%), the highest sales ever (5,368  9,182).
In particular, more than half of the electric vehicles sold last year, were high-priced lineups that cost more than KRW 100 million, such as EQE, EQS, EQS SUV, proving that the luxury strategy continues in the EV segment.
	
Top-end Luxury
	S-Class, which hit cumulative sales of 100K last year, and AMG models have shown steady sales, strengthening TEV strategy. (Large-size segment with 24% share of total sales)
Especially, the Maybach brand (MM S-Class 1609, MM GLS 987) achieved the highest sales ever, selling 2,596 units (+32% YoY).
G-Class also sold 2,169 units in 2023, the largest sales ever since its official launch in Korea in 2012.
	
Core Luxury
	Our full-size(E / GLE / EQE / CLS ) segment recorded 48% share of total sales
Among them, the E-Class(W213) remained strong with 23,642 units (31% of total sales) and showed a strong impression by becoming the best-selling sedan in the imported car market for 8 consecutive years even at the end of its life cycle.
	


I would like to thank our customers for their sincere support and love for MBK also in last year. This is a valuable achievement by Mercedes-Benz Korea and its 11 dealerships as a team despite difficult situations such as the economic downturn and high-interest rates.
If asked) The slight decrease in sales compared to the previous year was attributed to 1) global recession and high interest rates 2) stock run out of the W213 before the W214, and 3) delay in launching the facelifted compact model.


Background information (Internal)
	
MBK retail sales of 2023 recorded 76,697 units (KAIDA, 2022: 80,976 / -4,279 units YoY)

All figures are based on the MBK retail sales data
Decrease
Compact segment: - 44% YoY due to the delay in launch (9,884  5,545)
E-Class: - 5,000 units due to the W213 phase out (27,468  22,861)
S-Class: -2,200 units (13,208  10,999) 
AMG brand: -600 units (7,312  6,695)

Increase
SUV: + 2,000 units due to the full changed/facelifted GLC, GLE, GLS in 2H (16,272 18,201)
EQ: +82%, recorded the highest sales ever with 9,092 units
Maybach brand: recorded 2,579 units sales (2022: 1,956 units), the highest sales ever
G-Class: recorded 2,165 units sales(2022: 1,612 unit), the highest sales ever
	


(MV) Regarding the question above then what are the strategies and goals for 2024?
We're not just aiming for sales volume or market No.1. In this year, our strategy for ‘electrification’ and ‘luxury’ will remain unchanged by providing the most desirable cars starting the new E-Class.
Following the new E-Class, a series of new cars are on our pipeline this year such as CLE Coupe/Cabriolet, Maybach EQS SUV, and electric G-Class. Please stay tunned.
Also, we will continue our efforts to satisfy our customers by the best luxury experiences, and high-quality services as a top luxury automobile brand.

(MV) You said that MBK is not aiming to be the No. 1, but according to domestic media reports, the E-Class and other models have been discounted significantly. Some people criticized that MBK conducted excessive discount promotions encouraging competition among dealers to win BMW over and be the No1. What is MBK’s position on this issue? 
Again, we are not simply aiming for No.1 in sales volume. Based on our strategy of "electrification" and "luxury," we have done our best to bring the best luxury experience to our customers.
In the EV segment, MB electric vehicles increased +70.8% YoY to 9,182 units (11.9%), the highest sales ever (5,368  9,182).
Also, the luxury strategy was on the right track: Especially, the Maybach brand (MM S-Class 1609, MM GLS 987) achieved the highest sales ever, selling 2,596 units (+32% YoY) and S-Class achieved 100K units in last year.
Regarding the promotion, please understand it is difficult to say more in detail because promotions and benefits vary per dealer in general.  

(MV) Last year, MBK said its EV sales target was 15 percent of total sales, but actually achieved 11.9 percent. What do you think about the 3 percent shortfall? 
Our strategy for 'Electrification' remained unchanged and was right on track in the last year.
In the EV segment, we have proven our potential by recording the highest EV sales ever last year. MB electric vehicles increased +70.8% YoY to 9,182 units (11.9%), which is the highest sales ever (5,368  9,182).
This is due to our full EV portfolio including EQA, EQB, EQE, EQS, EQE SUV, EQS SUV and AMG EQ models. 
In particular, more than half of the electric vehicles sold last year, were high-priced lineups that cost more than KRW 100 million, such as EQE, EQS, EQS SUV, proving that the luxury strategy continues in the EV segment.

(MV) As the opinion that EVs are premature in the global market has emerged, the speed of conversion of automobile brands to electric vehicles is slowing down. MBK's EQ sales increased significantly in 2023 compared to the previous year, remaining No. 1 in the EV segment in Korea (except for Tesla). What do you think is the reason for Mercedes-Benz's popularity in the EV segment in Korea, and what will the company do for the domestic EV market in the future? 
We are aware that some say that EV growth will slow down by years. But, EV sales increasing in the global and domestic market.
(FYI, EV sales trend from EV Volumes)

Also many automotive players have kept releasing new EVs in the domestic market. As a result, EV sales in the imported car market increased by 14.5% YoY (KAIDA base).
We have solidified our strategic direction of ‘Electrification’ by completing a full EV portfolio. 
As a result, MB electric vehicles increased +70.8% YoY to 9,182 units (11.9%), the highest sales ever (5,368  9,182).
In particular, more than half of the electric vehicles sold last year, were high-priced lineups that cost more than KRW 100 million, such as EQE, EQS, EQS SUV, proving that the luxury strategy continues in the EV segment.
This year, we will introduce electric models in the TEV segment, including the Maybach EQS SUV and G-Class electric vehicles. 
Our ultimate goal is to strengthen customers' overall luxury EV experience across the entire product life cycle. To accomplish this goal, we will also invest in a Mercedes-Benz high-power-charging infrastructure in Korea. We plan to install approximately 150 charging points across 25 HPC charging sites by 2025 to provide an improved EV experience to electric vehicle customers.

Due to the recent hikes in the benchmark interest rate and economic downturn, this may have greater impacts on sales of TEV segment. What is MBK’s position on this?
Yes, it had an impact on our sales in the last year. But this also happened to other brands in Korean automotive market. In fact, sales of the whole imported car market, which is expected to be more affected, also fell last year compared to the previous year by -4.4% (KAIDA base).
Nevertheless, we have solidified our ‘luxury’ strategy in last year.
S-Class, which hit cumulative sales of 100K last year, and AMG models have shown steady sales, strengthening TEV strategy. 
Especially, the Maybach brand (MM S-Class 1609, MM GLS 987) achieved the highest sales ever, selling 2,596 units (+32% YoY).
G-Class also sold 2,169 units in 2023, the largest sales ever since its official launch in Korea in 2012.

(MV) SUVs dominate sales these days in the Korean automotive market. However, Mercedes-Benz Korea's core sales models are sedans. In addition to the E-Class, which was the best-selling imported car in 2023, the S-Class recently surpassed the 100,000 unit mark, a rare feat for an imported luxury flagship. What is MBK's future strategy?
In the last years, the growth of SUVs was remarkable in the domestic automotive market (SUV 734,573  802,974, +9.3% YoY / Sedan 494,951  495,450, +0.1% YoY, Carisyou Base)
Sales of SUVs in MBK are also growing (+1,929 units YoY) by strengthening our SUV lineup for the second half of 2023. From internal combustion engine SUVs such as The new GLC, The new GLE, and The new GLS, electric SUVs such as EQS SUV and EQE SUV have also been introduced. Electric SUVs like EQS SUV and EQE SUV have also been launched in the Korean market to provide wider EV choices. We will keep strengthening our SUV portfolio this year with MM GLS, MM EQS SUV, and the new EQA/EQB. 
But still, Mercedes-Benz thinks that the presence of a limousine, sedan in the fleet portfolio is very important for us as a luxury brand. In particular, in the case of S-Class and E-Class, since they are in charge of top-end and core luxury in our luxury strategy, they will continue to play an important role in our portfolio in the future. 

(MV) The 10th-generation E-Class (W213) was very popular in Korea, with sales exceeding 200,000 units as a single model. Do you expect this E-Class model to sell more than that?
E-Class is a very important model in Korea, which is called the 'heart of the brand. With many previous successes and records, E-Class has kept a strong position in the Korean market. (200K units of sales achievement, the best-selling imported cars for 8 consecutive years)
Due to this popularity, Korea has become a key market for the world's No. 1 E-Class sedan sales from 2018 to the present, and we are very thankful for the attention from customers to E-Class.
The new E-Class which is the most luxurious intelligent sedan ever, takes the luxury digital experience to a new level with highlights in personalization and digitalization. We believe it will appeal to early adopters and tech-savvy Korean consumers.
Also, we are offering a wide range of customer choices with seven models, reflecting Korean customers’ preferences. So, I’m confident that the new E-Class is highly anticipated by customers and will continue the prestige of the previous model.

(MV) South Korea is the No.1 market for the E-Class globally, and the E-Class is the best-selling imported vehicle model in the country. Given the importance of the Korean market, the BMW 5 series was launched for the first time in the world, so why not the E-Class? Do you think the new E-Class will be able to retain its number one position in Korea in this new car race?
As you said, Korea has become a key market for the world's No. 1 E-Class sedan sales from 2018 to the present, and we are very thankful for the attention from customers to E-Class. 
The new E-Class which is the most luxurious intelligent sedan ever, takes the luxury digital experience to a new level with highlights in personalization and digitalization.
The preferences of Korean customers had a major impact on the development of the new E-Class. Mercedes-Benz takes the feedback of Korean customers very seriously and has collaborated with Korean companies on the new E-Class to strengthen quality and relevance.
So, we are offering a wide range of customer choices with seven models, reflecting Korean customers’ preferences. So, I’m confident that the new E-Class is highly anticipated by customers and will continue the prestige of the previous model.
If asked) Korea is the first market to launch the new E-Class outside Europe ahead of US market.
(FYI, W214 was launched in the European market, in September 2023. Not launched yet in the US market, China)

[Corporate Issue]
Local Investment & Network Expansion

(MV) although MBK ranked 2nd place last year, sales are high. But it seems your local investment is very weak. Does MBK have any plan for local investment or new facility construction in Korea, this year?
First, we are thankful to our customers for their continued love and support towards our brand. And MBK has been, and will continue to pursue mutual growth in Korean society.
Over the past few years, MBK has expanded the local infrastructure in Korea with a significant amount of investments along with the growth in business. The examples are ‘R&D Korea Center’, ‘Parts Distribution Center’, and ‘Training Center’.
Further, Korea is one of the most important partners for Mercedes-Benz in terms of procurement and supply. Supported by the broad ecosystem and high competitiveness of the Korean automobile industry, we have been working with many different Korean supply partners for many years.
The number of Korean companies registered as supply partners of Mercedes-Benz is known to be more than 100 in various fields such as displays, battery cells, and HVAC.
The open innovation platform ‘STARTUP AUTOBAHN Korea’ is another way of contributing. Since the program started in 2020, STARTUP AUTOBAHN has nurtured startups every year, supporting a total of 40 promising startups.
Last but not least, MB CSR Committee consisting of MBK, MBFSK and 11 dealers has been collecting donations matching the increasing sales volume through the CSR fund, which is the largest level among imported auto brands. MB CSR Committee’s CSR fund has reached about KRW 46.4 billion on a cumulative basis since 2014. 

(MV) Imported car brands are continuously criticized for lacking service centers, which results in a long service waiting time. As the No. 1 brand in the imported car industry, what is MBK's network expansion plan? 
Mercedes-Benz Korea currently operates 64 showrooms and 77 service centers across the country. MBK has reorganized our infrastructure with our strategy to improve the quality of customer services through customer demand surveys and market analysis. 
In 2023, total number of work bays was expanded to 1,431, adding about 100 more compared to the previous year, and the major focus was on upgrading the quality of existing service centers. 
In addition to strengthening customer service through offline network facilities, we are also strengthening digital capability to upgrade customer service comfort(For example, MBK offers a range of digital services. In 2020, the digital platform ‘Digital Service Drive’ was launched, allowing customers to make online reservations for authorized service centers 24 hours a day, communicate with technicians in real time, and check digital work preparation documents. We launched ‘CitNOW’ service in 2022. Service centers use the service where videos are sent to the customer's mobile phone to immediately explain the inspection results.)
This year, MBK plans to add a new showroom, which is the world's first Maybach Brand Center, and two more service centers. MBK plans to make efforts to strengthen the accessibility of existing service centers and expand the availabilities of service areas that customer can experience. 
In addition, all service centers out of a total of 77 service centers, have the equipment, technology, and manpower capable of maintaining electric vehicles, and we are in the process of expanding maintenance infrastructure in line with the era of electrification. 
In addition, more than 6,200 employees from 11 dealer companies are doing their best to provide the highest service quality for sales and after-sales nationwide.

(MV) Some point out that MBK’s overall donation amount is still small considering the leading brand which had been number one past 7 years in the imported auto market. What is MBK’s position on such criticism? 
MBK, its 11 authorized dealers and affiliate companies, and Mercedes-Benz Finance Service Korea together have collected funds based on every vehicle unit sold and donated them via Mercedes-Benz CSR Committee.
The accumulated donation has reached a total of KRW 46.4 billion which is the largest amount among imported car brands since the Mercedes-Benz CSR Committee launched in 2014. And it is the largest amount among imported auto brands in Korea.
Moreover, the MB CSR Committee is striving to provide practical support to Korean society and local government. Especially, MB CSR Committee has raised more than KRW 5.6 billion through tenth GIVE ‘N RACE.
Beyond the financial donation, our CSR activities have created a lot of meaningful social values. The bottom line is that, for us, CSR means more than the total sum of donations.

Dividend Issue

(MV) Mercedes-Benz Korea has sent most of profit as dividend until last year so far. And it feels like MBK care too little for an investment or donation in Korea. Why is MBK sending the profit overseas, not investing in Korea?
MBK follows Mercedes-Benz AG’s policy which values its investors.
The dividend is mostly reinvested into R&D to realize the vision for future mobility, and to achieve product innovations and service quality improvements.
With this regard, in 2021, Mercedes-Benz's supervisory board signed off an investment plan worth more than EUR 60 billion (USD 67.88 billion) for the Mercedes-Benz passenger car and van businesses from 2022 to 2026. 
MBK actively invests in the Korean market to improve customer service satisfaction and has laid the foundation for job creation and revitalization of the local economy.
MBK’s CSR fund records the highest among imported car brands in Korea and will continue to develop win-win management with Korean society.
MB R&D Korea Center has been contributing to the development of automobile R&D business in Korea in collaboration with numerous Korean corporate partners and suppliers. 
In 2023, MBK had expanded its in-house R&D center in terms of its size and area of development fields. Moreover, it added 50% more manpower to the existing one.

(MV) What is the outlook for this year’s dividend payout ratio? 
MBK follows the decision of the shareholder meeting at Mercedes-Benz AG and Mercedes-Benz AG values its investors.
Please understand that we cannot make further comments on it at this moment.

[Recently Raised issue by Media]
ROF

(MV) It was announced through the media last year that MBK will switch its sales model from dealer sales(D2C) to direct sales through online (RoF). It has recently been known that some dealer companies are concerning that their business scale possibly can be squeezed with some negative feedback. What is the progress and status for this?
Mercedes-Benz Korea has been holding inclusive and transparent discussions with all of our dealers about strategies to improve our business for both customers and our business partners, reacting to the rapidly changing automotive industry.
Please understand that it is difficult to disclose further details of our internal business discussions.

(MV) Is the ‘2026’ a fixed date? (or is there any fixed date to start?) How will it be implemented specifically?
Please understand that it is difficult to comment on the details of our internal discussions. We will continue the open discussion with our dealers to ensure that both customers and business partners are satisfied.

Celebrity singer's S-Class sudden unintended acceleration claim


(Background Information: only FYI, not for communication)
An S-Class driven by the wife of a famous Korean singer, Woon-Do Seol, crashed into a restaurant.
The singer and his agency claimed the accident was caused by the S-Class's "sudden unintended acceleration.”
The singer and his agency have been actively giving interviews to the media and appearing on car accident programs, claiming that the problem was caused by the Mercedes-Benz S-Class. 
Mercedes-Benz Korea responded to the situation by saying, "We need to verify the vehicle, but it is impossible to do so because it has been transferred to the National Forensic Service," and "We have not confirmed any cases of sudden death due to defective vehicles."  
	


(MV) Recently, a famous singer claimed that his S-Class was involved in a ‘sudden Unintended acceleration’ accident. What is Mercedes-Benz Korea's position on this incident and how is the investigation progressing? 
We feel sorry to hear the incident. Mercedes-Benz Korea has communicated with the driver to provide information about the investigation process. We understand that the investigation by police department of the accident is now ongoing.
Once the vehicle is brought to our service center and the customer makes a request, we will do our best to support to the customer's request, including closely analyzing the vehicle's driving information and investigating the exact cause.
Mercede-Benz Korea can confirm, so far there is no case known to us whereby a vehicle defect leading to sudden accelerator was determined.

Suspicion on North Korean leader Kim’s private car, Maybach & bypass export to Russia by dealer

(MV) North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has been observed switching to a new Mercedes-Benz Maybach S 650. Maybach is subject to the UN Security Council's export ban to North Korea. Did you aware of this?

HQ Media Statement

- For Mercedes-Benz, the export of products in conformance with applicable law is a fundamental principle of entrepreneurial responsibility.
- Mercedes-Benz has had no business connections with North Korea for far more than 15 years now and strictly complies with US and EU embargoes. 
- To prevent deliveries to North Korea, Mercedes-Benz has implemented a comprehensive export control process.
- Sales of vehicles by third parties, especially of used vehicles, are beyond our control and responsibility.
- We always investigate the vehicles displayed on the photos in the media thoroughly. However, without the vehicle identification numbers it is impossible to find a concrete trace. 
- Please understand that we have no indication how those vehicles have come to the use of the government of North Korea.
	


(MV) In this regard, how is the issue of dealers' bypass export to Russia managed, which was raised in April?
MBK guides all regulations to 11 dealers. The regulations also include prohibiting sales to customers listed on the unlicensed list. If the dealer is aware of misconduct by its employees, the dealer company is asking for appropriate measures to be taken. In addition, we will do our best to ensure that compliance-related training is conducted regularly and continuously and sales are made in accordance with the regulations.

[Customer Services]

(MV) According to the recent announcement (Dec 2023) from the ‘Korea Consumer Agency’, MB is known to have the highest number of applications for consumer damage relief related to vehicle quality or aftersales service among imported car brands. Is there any plan for improvement in product and after-sales service quality? 
We apologize if any customer is dissatisfied due to an issue with our products or after-sales service. Customer satisfaction is our top priority. We will work with 11 dealer companies to actively and closely communicate with each customer, and we will keep striving to provide the best service to customers who drive our vehicles.

According to data released by the Korea Consumer Agency on December 12, 2023, the number of auto-related damage relief claims received between 2020 and 2022 was 761 for Korean-made cars and 697 for imported cars. By type of damage, quality problems accounted for 868 cases (59.5%), followed by after-sales service with 375 cases (25.7%), and contract problems with 208 cases (14.3%). In terms of the number of claims per 10,000 vehicles, Chevrolet had the highest number of claims at 7.4 among domestic manufacturers, followed by Renault Korea Motors at 5.2, KG Mobility at 3.2, and Hyundai Motor and Kia at 1.2 each. Among import manufacturers, Land Rover received 44.0 claims, followed by Honda 19.0, Ford 15.2, Jeep 13.7, Audi 11.3, Volkswagen 8.6, Volvo 7.8, Mercedes Benz 6.8, and BMW and Tesla 5.9 each.

[NOx Sensor Issue]

(MV) Mercedes-Benz Korea has extended warranty coverage to some of the diesel vehicles may have NOx sensor defects and is offering free repairs when we find a problem. Does MBK have a plan to reimburse customers for the cost already paid for the repair?
We have communicated with individual customers after looking into details as all cases might have different features.
We will provide you more detailed information through our PR team.

FYI. Background Information
In 2020, MOE approved recall of NOx sensors for 64,093 vehicles from MY2015 – 2018. But MBK could not proceed the recall due to part supply & software development bottleneck until September of last year. 
In Jan 2023, YTN TV reported several number of customers were experiencing rusted NOx Sensors and warning lamp alert. MBK mentioned that we were in the process of preparing the recall. 
In Sep 2023, MBK started warranty extension of 80,951 vehicles from 7years/100,000 km to 8 years/ unlimited mileage & announced MOE recall to vehicles exceeding 7 years/100,000 km (MY 2015, 2016). (***For MOE recall campaign and Warranty Extension, customer who repaired NOx sensors before the campaign commencement, cost doesn’t need to reimbursed by OEM) 

FYI. Position Statement
We apologize to the customer who is experiencing inconvenience due to the related symptoms, and we will do our best to minimize customer inconvenience.
Customers can have their vehicle diagnosed at any Mercedes-Benz authorized service center of their choice, and if it is found to be defective, it will be repaired free of charge under this warranty extension.
We have communicated with individual customers after looking into details as all cases might have different features.
	




[EV Charging Stations expansion] 
(KT) Recently, BMW Korea invested heavily in the public charging infrastructure. What plan does MBK have in terms of EV charging infrastructure to support EQ customers? Plus, Ola Källenius announced at the press conference in Korea, last year that it will launch a global branded high-power charging network in Korea. Does MBK have a specific plan for this in Korea?
MBK is trying to strengthen customers’ premium electric experiences during the entire product life cycle, and EV charging infrastructure is one of the important areas that we are working on.
As of now, MB EQ customers can use about 180,000 chargers nationwide including 240 Mercedes-Benz public chargers (272 charging points).

To further support our ambition in electric drive, we will also invest in a Mercedes-Benz high-power-charging infrastructure in Korea following Germany(Mannheim), USA(Georgia), China(Chengdu). We plan to install approximately 150 charging points across 25 HPC charging sites by 2025. Featuring a robust charging speed of up to 350KW with Mercedes-Benz style, the infrastructure is designed to deliver a rapid, convenient, dependable, and premium charging experience for all EV drivers, extending beyond our Mercedes-Benz customers. Furthermore, we are eager to extend our reach by expanding AC and DC charging stations in the areas where EV drivers seek reliable charging solutions.

(KT) Is there a plan to change the charging standard from DC Combo to NACS in Korea like in North America?
After all, the key to everything is what the customer wants. Customer-centric approach is the most important to us. The reason why we adopted the NACS charging method in the North American market is that customers in the North American market are most convenient for Mercedes-Benz customers.
In this context, DC Combo is the standard in the Korean market and many customers are using it. We will try our best to enhance EV customer experiences through the whole cycle.

(KT) On January 1st, 2023, MBK said it would stop the complimentary charging service provided to MB EQ customers at MB showrooms and service centers since 2019. But it was decided to postpone it for one year due to high complaints from customers because the complimentary charging was one of the motivations for purchasing the EQ. If so, the service will be terminated as of the end of 2023, will the service be terminated as expected from this year? How are you planning to deal with this?
The complimentary charging service for MB EQ customers ended on January 1, 2024 after a one-year grace period in 2023. This was announced to customers three times in 2023 through the Mercedes me charge app (February 14, 2023 / August 29, 2023 / December 5, 202).
Our ultimate goal is to strengthen customers' overall luxury EV experience across the entire product life cycle. To accomplish this goal, we will also invest in a Mercedes-Benz high-power-charging infrastructure in Korea. We plan to install approximately 150 charging points across 25 HPC charging sites by 2025 to provide an improved EV experience to electric vehicle customers.

(FYI, Complimentary charging service termination notice on MMC app.)


[EV subsidy] 
(MV) MoE is known to consider revising its EV subsidy scheme for 2024. What is MBK's response to this? 
Mercedes-Benz Korea understands that the purpose of MoE’s EV subsidy is to support the growth of the EV market and to transform the industry in an eco-friendlier way.
We think that EV subsidy is important for us because electrification is our key strategy in 2024 as well.
At the same time, the EV subsidies should be determined with the principle of fair opportunity, reciprocity, and sustainability since subsidies have a direct impact on the market.
(To be updated once the 2024 EV Subsidy is determined)

(MV) While the exact 2024 EV Subsidy has yet to be announced, an announcement was made last month on changes to the cold weather driving range standard. EQA, EQB are expected to be excluded from the subsidy. In that case, isn't there an impact on sales of MBK? Are there any EV models that are eligible for the 2024 EV Subsidy? 
Current EQA and EQB can be received because they are based on a 2023 EV subsidy.
Whether those two modes will be eligible for 2024 EV subsidy or not will be decided when the new EV subsidy standard is confirmed. Please understand we cannot comment on this at this moment. I will share it with you when the subsidy is confirmed in 2024.

[Recalls]
(MV) No. of recalls is increasing steadily as the data shows us. What is MBK’s position regarding the recall?
We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience caused by recalls.
Due to the complexities in vehicles such as the interactions of mechanic, electronic, and software elements, the spectrum of recalls is covered wide, but it is our responsibility to maintain our vehicles across the entire product life cycle and protect them from the defect that compromises safety. 
The recalls can be performed at workshops or via OTA.

[Online Sales]
(KT) MBK has started online sales in 2021. What is the current performance and what’s the plans for next year (e.g. online special model)?
We are offering seamless customer experiences both online and offline for new cars and used cars. And online sales have increased since MBK launched the ‘Mercedes-Benz Store’ in 2021. 
In 2023, about 5.7% of Mercedes-Benz's new car sales and 17.6% of CPO sales were made online. Especially, and new car sales online has grown to 14.5% compared to 2.2% in 2021.
Also, we launched the Mercedes-Benz Korea 20th Anniversary Online Special last year. Customers showed great support for those models and Some of the models sold out quickly.
This year, we are targeting to sell 13% of new cars and 15% of CPO sale through online in 2024. 
MBK plans to upload strategic models as online special models in 2024 aligning with new car momentums like the new E-Class. Stay tuned for our new online specials.

[Digital Service Product (Subscription product)]
(KT) MBK has opened the Mercedes me Store in 2020 and has sold a wide range of digital service products. Please share future service launch plans.
Mercedes-Benz provides specific functions and entertainment elements of the vehicle according to individual preferences and needs through the 'Mercedes Me Store' for the purpose of improving customer experience in the digital sector.
This ensures the best flexibility and choice for customers by adding new features to vehicles that have already been purchased according to the needs or choices of customers.

[Digital Service Product Portfolio] 
- 3 Digital Service Product Packages: Excellence Package, Remote Package, Navigation Package
- 12 Digital Service Product: Smartphone Integration, Real Axle Steering with large steering angle, Programming of charging settings and Pre-Entry Climate Control, Individualization Package, Remote Parking Assist, Digital Radio, AMG Track pace, Hard-disc Navigation, Engine Start, Beginner Driver and Valet Service Mode, Energizing Package, Active Distance Assist DISTRONIC
	

Especially, In Car Store was introduced in December 1st as an additional touchpoint for customers to conveniently purchase digital products in the head unit. Monthly subscription-based digital products with 1-month free trial will be introduced to provide more flexible offerings to customers in need of experience before purchase. We will share more in details when it is ready.


Background regarding Rear-axle steering service

In 2022, MB turned the Rear-axle steering service into a paid service to provide various features on a subscription basis. Some point out that it is absurd to charge fees on already-built-in hardware features.

Media Statement
The Mercedes Me Store, which opened in 2020, offers a wide range of service products, including ▲renewal-type services (vehicle settings, vehicle monitoring, navigation system, online map updates, remote parking assist, etc.) and ▲on-demand-type services (hard-disk navigation, integrated smartphone packages, digital radio, and AMG Track Pace.)
Starting in October 2022, ▲ Rear-axle steering (up to 10 degrees) and ▲ individual packages (including features such as mini-games and EV sound experience) have been added to the Mercedes Me Store.
MBK further plans to provide a rich customer experience with digital service offerings for in-car entertainment and various vehicle functionality upgrades.
The newly launched vehicles are gradually changing in the form of digital machines, and in the future, more digitalized products will be introduced to support upgrades in vehicle functionality.
This allows customers to pay efficiently only for the desired feature, for a certain period of time, and we expect that the software updates and improvements will enable continued upgrades of the product and service experience.

	


[The new E-Class]
(KT) The new E-class seems to be equipped with many new digital elements such as the 3rd generation MBUX. What are the most significant features of the new E-Class, and to what end has it been fully changed?
E-Class is our core luxury model in MB global portfolio and also an important model in Korea with a stubborn market position. 
The new E-Class which is the most intelligent sedan ever, takes the luxury digital experience to a new level.
The new E-Class is equipped with state-of-the-art technologies focusing on digitalization and personalization.
For digitalization, there are new features like 3rd generation MBUX, precursor of MB.OS and MBUX Superscreen and those features are closely connected and give the driver a seamless digital experience. Also, we provide an extensive app portfolio including local apps like essential; Wavve, Flo, Melon
The new Routine function which is based on AI allows you to preset the perfect driving environment and even proposes personalized routines by learning from your behavior. 
We believe those features will appeal to early adopters and tech-savvy Korean consumers.
The new E-Class elevates the comfort to a new level. In order to reduce noise from the development stage, the angle of the A-pillar, side mirrors, and body shape were designed to reduce noise. Noise flowing into the interior was minimized through sealing and insulation.
Also, we are offering a wide range of customer choices with seven models, reflecting Korean customers’ preferences. I’m confident that the new E-Class is also highly anticipated by customers and will continue the prestige of the previous model.

(KT) You've announced that the new E-Class will be available in seven models. What is the release timing of the 7 models?
Korea is an important market for Mercedes-Benz, with consumers who have a wide range of tastes. We tried to offer a wide range of choices, while including options that Korean consumers will love. 
First, we introduced three models from today: E 220d 4M Exclusive, E 300 4M Exclusive, E 300 4M AMG line. E 200 Avantguarde, E 450 Exclusive will be launched within 1H of this year, and PHEV model, E 350 e Exclusive will be launched in 2H of this year. AMG E 53 e 4Matic is not launched yet globlally, so we will share when it is ready to come out.

(KT) Among the seven models, a diesel model (E220 d Exclusive) is included. Mercedes-Benz is putting a strong drive on the electrification strategy, why is the diesel model included? Is customer response still expected to be good for diesel models?
We tried to offer a wide range of choices, while including options that Korean consumers will love. 
In the case of the new E-class, it is a best-selling vehicle with a wide variety of customer choices. Although it seems that gasoline will be the volume model, diesel models will be provided as much as demand exists in Korea.
One option among them is the E220d model, which is a diesel model. However, as I shared earlier in the announcement, this new E-class lineup is equipped with a mild hybrid or plug-in hybrid system, so all of them can be seen as electrified models.
The E 200d model is also equipped with a 48V mild hybrid system, making it a reasonable option for customers who want more efficiency and performance.

(KT) The new E-Class is fully-changed and represents a significant improvement from the previous generation model. However, the price increase does not seem to be as high as expected. Is this due to the popularity of the E-Class in Korea or the similar timing to the new 5 Series? 
The price is determined by various factors, 
Mercedes-Benz Korea has been actively listening to the customer’s feedback and market needs and reflecting them on the new product. Through close discussions with the headquarters, we tried to reasonably set the price of the new E-Class by reflecting the feedback and needs of customers.
In particular, the E 300 Exclusive and AMG models, which are expected to be in high demand for Korean customers, are about KRW 1.5 million to 1.8 million lower than the previous model (E 350) but are more competitive in product composition. In particular, the price increase of the E200 model was minimized.

(KT) Regarding the above question, the specification of engine trims for W214 seems to have slightly lowered compared to the same level of trims in W213 (e.g. W213 E 250 (M274)  W214 E 200 (M254) / W213 E 350 (M264)  W214 E 300 (M254)). Is the price lowered due to the lower engine specifications? 
The naming logic of HQ has been changed by equipping the latest 4-cylinder petrol engine (M254) in the new E-Class. As a result, E250 and E350 at W213 were renamed from W241 to E200 and E300, respectively. M254 engine boosts tremendous pulling power even at low engine speeds - this is what distinguishes this advanced 4-cylinder petrol engine with a mild hybrid and 48-volt on-board electrical system.


(KT) When does the official launch of local apps including T-Map announced today? Will all apps run on the central display and passenger screen? 
In the case of T-Map, it will be available through retrofit starting in the 2nd half of 2024. T-map will be officially launched from MY25 models which are equipped with the 3rd generation MBUXY. Regarding the previously released 3rd generation MBUX vehicles, T-map will be updated later through retrofit.
Essential;, Flo, Wavve, and Melon will be available from the launch date using wifi tethering, and will be available with 5G, an in-car embedded data, through OTA starting in Q3 of this year.
Apple Music, Vivaldi, YouTube Web, and essential; are available in the passenger seat at the time of launch, and other apps will be available in the passenger seat through OTA later.

(KT) Will the 5G data be sold in a separate data package? Or is it included in the vehicle price? With which company in Korea does the 5G technology work to provide? 
5G data charges are included in vehicle prices on a one- and three-year basis and must be extended through the Mercedes Me Store after expiration.

[FYI] Entertainment Package Plus (49U) license runtime.
- CY23/1: 1 year + compensation
- CY23/2~: 3 years
	

Although 5G data are provided in collaboration with KT, the technology solution for in-car embedded data is developed by Mercedes-Benz as below. 

(KT) According to the recent CES announcement, various updates have been made, such as installing MBUX virtual assistants and expanding app content. As far as I know, the new E-class will be equipped with a precursor of MB.OS, can these digital elements be experienced in this E-class as well?
As you said, this new E-class will be equipped with a precursor of Mercedes-Benz's own developed operating system, MB.OS.
Various contents were announced at CES, but please understand we cannot share any plans for adopting those features to the new E-Class as of not.
Instead, the new E-Class will feature global apps such as Webex, Zoom, TikTok, and Angrybird, as well as a variety of localized apps such as essential;, Flo, Wave, and Melon that will maximize the in-car experience of Korean customers. It will then provide more diverse global and local apps through constant updates.

(KT) What are the technical features of the new E-Class and what are the advantages that differentiate it from the EQ models, especially the EQE? 
It's a platform which derived from a combustion engine but the electrifying. This platform and all the combustion engines, all the cars will have a 48V system. And the mild hybrid version, we'll have a 27kW e-motor already supporting the combustion engine. And with an integrated starter-generator, which we call ISG which is very convenient starting up the engine start and stop functions will be very convenient when you stop at a crossing and the combustion engine is switched off. So, that's going to be a very, very smooth experience for the customers on the mild hybrids.  
And I mentioned already the plug-in-hybrid, which is probably one of the largest batteries and ranges over 100km (WLTP) in the whole field of competition. I mentioned the air suspension ADS+ system in the car, which will give us the most comfortable ride in the vehicle. So I would say these are the main elements of this vehicle.  
And comparison to the EQE, of course, here we're offering a plug-in-hybrid version in the new E-Class. Not all customers are ready for electric vehicles. Sometimes they have range anxiety sometimes they think that the charging infrastructure is not sufficient. But with the plug-in-hybrids, we're making a great offer here for those customers who want to experience both sides the combustion engine long range plus taking the step into the electric world and starting to charge their car driving electric whenever they can. So, I think it's a good compromise for those customers. But if the customer is ready, of course, there is an offer which is called EQE that we as Mercedes have also installed. (From CTO interview)

(KT) Foreign media are reporting that the new E-Class is the "last new internal combustion engine model". So, will the E-Class be merged with the EQE in the future, or will it disappear from the lineup?
It is true that this E-Class is the last internal combustion engine model, but there are no plans to merge with EQE, which is based on the EVA2 platform for electric vehicles. The current E-Class will be operated as a pure electric vehicle, and we will introduce large-segment sedan and compact models based on new platforms such as MB.EA and MMA in the future.

[HQ Strategy] 
(KT) In 2022, Mercedes-Benz AG announced that it would focus on high-end luxury models and EVs in the future. Then did it mean that it would discontinue or reduce the production of entry models (compact vehicles) such as the A-Class and the B-Class?
Mercedes-Benz will focus on elevating 'luxury' value while maintaining the sales volume of each segment.
Accordingly, we are sharpening the focus of our product portfolio in a way to maximize the potential of Mercedes-Benz in the rapidly changing market conditions.
We plan to strengthen the top-end segment in line with the global strategies of the German headquarters.
However, it does not mean that the entry models will be discontinued immediately. We plan to particularly strengthen the luxury specifications in the entry segments.
Business management for each segment will be determined according to market conditions and consumer demand.

(KT) According to foreign media, it is said that Mercedes-Benz will drop ‘EQ’ brand as soon as the next-generation cars are set to be on the market at the end of 2024. Any comment or confirmation regarding the news?
“It is still important to us to underpin our strategic pillar "Lead in Electric" with the brand Mercedes-EQ. With the EQ models, we address customers who feel particularly addressed by progressiveness and innovative strength in the field of e-mobility. With the aim of becoming fully electric from our parent brand Mercedes-Benz by the end of the decade, we will adapt the positioning of the vehicles and thus also the use of the brand in a contemporary way, but it is still too early for details.”(Source from HQ PR)
